TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: tiamen a se Payuan tangidangida a vakela a vuluq a kuang na navunavuq a inalang.
tiamen a se Payoan tangidangida a vakela a voloq a koang na navonavoq a inalang.
S.TRANSL: Long ago we Paiwans had arrows, spears and guns made of bamboo.

S.FORM: qau nu maqinatsap i tuazua, maqaqetsi tuazua inalang na vunavuq.
qao no maqinacap i toazoa, maqaqeci toazoa inalang na vonavoq.
S.TRANSL: When we went head-hunting at that time, we fought with weapons made of bamboo.

S.FORM: a vatu kiayan a pusaladj.
a vato kiayan a posaladj.
azua tsautsau a ngadan nu tapaw Paitudjan, ngadan nu tsautsau Vatjułayan, aya tangidangida.
azoa caocao a ngadan no tapaw Paitodjan, ngadan no caocao Vatjoljayan, aya tangidangida.
S.TRANSL: They say that long ago there was a man from the Paitudjan family whose name was Vatjułayan.

S.FORM: namaqaqetsi tua łapiłapi timadju; tapuluq a vatu.
namaqaqeci toa ljapiljapi timadjo; tapoloq a vato.
S.TRANSL: He fought people of nearby villages, and had ten dogs.

S.FORM: azua łapiłapi lima puluq a tsautsau.
azoa ljapiljapi lima poloq a caocao.
S.TRANSL: There were 50 people from the other villages;

S.FORM: tjuruvu a matsay; maḍusanga mevałut, aya a tjautsikel a kemasi tsuayan.
tjorovo a macay; madrosanga mevaljot, aya a tjaocikel a kemasi coayan.
S.TRANSL: many died and only two survived, according to the old story.

S.FORM: azua ti sa Vatjułayan anga nu uḍain a vatu a mapaqaqepu; nu migatsał timadju, isangas a vatu.
azoa ti sa Vatjoljayan anga no odrain a vato a mapaqaqepo; no migacalj timadjo, isangas a vato.
S.TRANSL: When Vatjułayan called, his dogs gathered; and when he got up to go, the dogs went first.

S.FORM: nu mavilad a qała, avan a vatu a lemaing.
no mavilad a qalja, avan a vato a lemaing.
S.TRANSL: If the enemy ran away, it was the dogs which pursued them.

S.FORM: qau ti sa Vatjułayan vaik a beniłung ta lailaingen anga nua vatu nimadju.
qao ti sa Vatjoljayan vaik a beniljong ta lailaingen anga noa vato nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: And Vatjułayan went and ambushed(?) those who were being pursued by his dogs.

S.FORM: qau azua qała ini anga ka djemalim.
qao azoa qalja ini anga ka djemalim.
S.TRANSL: So the enemies could not win.

S.FORM: łevavaw tua kasiw.
ljevavaw toa kasiw.
qau katsen a zuma azua qała.
qao kacen a zoma azoa qalja.
S.TRANSL: But some of the enemies were bitten.

S.FORM: nu łevavaw tua kasiw, katsen nua vatu a qapulu nua kasiw.
no ljevavaw toa kasiw, kacen noa vato a qapolo noa kasiw.
S.TRANSL: When they climbed trees, the dogs bit the trunks of the trees.

S.FORM: qau inika djemalim a tsautsau.
qao inika djemalim a caocao.
saka małi ti sa Vatjułayan a penanapanaq.
saka malji ti sa Vatjoljayan a penanapanaq.
S.TRANSL: And Vatjułayan was an expert archer.

S.FORM: avanu sika padjavay a matsay nuazua qała, maya a kai a kemasi tsuayan tangidangida.
avano sika padjavay a macay noazoa qalja, maya a kai a kemasi coayan tangidangida.
S.TRANSL: That’s why so many of the enemies died, according to the story from long ago in the past.
